item.title: lowercase <-> uppercase
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: Variable-Case’s unique trait lies in its ability to switch between uppercase and lowercase letters based on where they sit vertically. I made a website to see the font in action. * Font testing site here vanghoa.github.io/VariableCase.* Take a look at the github repository.
item.content:encoded:
Variable-Case’s unique trait lies in its ability to switch between uppercase and lowercase letters based on where they sit vertically. I made a website to see the font in action.

* Font testing site here vanghoa.github.io/VariableCase.
* Take a look at the github repository.

  • Bảo Anh as graphic designer
  • Darius Ou for consultation
  • This project was done as part of a course module at LASALLE College of the Arts

item.title: Vietnamme Magazine
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: Vietnamme, an art organization in Vietnam, had been proposing the idea of a web magazine platform dedicated to exploring how the youth redefine and push the boundaries of art, irrespective of its form. I’m initially tasked with producing digital illustrations for two articles within the magazine.
item.content:encoded:
Vietnamme, an art organization in Vietnam, had been proposing the idea of a web magazine platform dedicated to exploring how the youth redefine and push the boundaries of art, irrespective of its form. I’m initially tasked with producing digital illustrations for two articles within the magazine.

  • Bảo Anh as website co-developer, website designer and illustrator
  • Diệu Ly as website co-developer and graphic designer
  • Minh Anh, and My Hà as graphic designer
  • Minh Phương, Anh Huy, and Chi Doan as illustrator
  • Vietnamme Magazine team for other content, and copy

item.title: trămđốt
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: After the closure of Ươm, a renowned hangout in Saigon’s creative scene, its founder, ltlt.company, has transitioned its legacy into the digital world with their latest cultural platform, trămđốt. trămđốt design tries capture the nostalgic aesthetics of massively multiplayer online games (MMOs) from the 2010s. These games, including titles like Club Penguin or the Vietnamese […]
item.content:encoded:
After the closure of Ươm, a renowned hangout in Saigon’s creative scene, its founder, ltlt.company, has transitioned its legacy into the digital world with their latest cultural platform, trămđốt.

trămđốt design tries capture the nostalgic aesthetics of massively multiplayer online games (MMOs) from the 2010s. These games, including titles like Club Penguin or the Vietnamese equivalents like Online Gunny and Bang Bang, were immensely popular among our generation.

For social media, I created this fun create-your-own-ASCII web for the audience to have their personalized ASCII person, using our idiosyncratic font. You can try here https://nguoi.tramdot.app/

It’s nice that it created a lot of attention. Thanks to all the friends to try on our small little fun mascot.

  • Bao Anh as graphic designer
  • Hải Phan & Tùng Sơn Lê as web developers
  • Duy Anh & Lê Minh as project director
  • chị Thy as project manager
  • This work is done for ltlt.company/trămđốt

item.title: Measure a machine’s heart
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: In this project, I gave a machine a kind of human-like passion and showed how that passion either ramps up (lights up) or fades away (burns out) depending on a few factors. The visual style is reminiscent of the data you see on an ECG machine, and all of that can be explored within the […]
item.content:encoded:
In this project, I gave a machine a kind of human-like passion and showed how that passion either ramps up (lights up) or fades away (burns out) depending on a few factors. The visual style is reminiscent of the data you see on an ECG machine, and all of that can be explored within the developer tools.

  • Visit the site here vanghoa.github.io/bonghoanho/.
  • Take a look at the github repository.

Visualizing in the Styles panel

Visualizing in the Console panel

Visualizing camera projection into ASCII art and microphone recording into the remote size (viewed inside the <head></head> tag), this was added when I tried to improve this project as a submission to HTML Review 2024

  • Thank you Tường Vi Ng for reaching out to me for showing it at the Bông Hoa Nhỏ exhibition 2023 by Bắp Xào
  • Thank you Max & Shelby for allowing me to show and improve this work on HTML Review 2024.

item.title: vanghoa.github.io
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: This marked my first time developing a website entirely from scratch, without the use of plugins or web-building tools. I hand-coded the site using only plain HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript, then slapped it up on Github Pages as a static website. All that stuff I’d been accumulating from my past projects, from Semplice, from […]
item.content:encoded:
• Visit the vanghoa.github.io to see the website.
  • Take a look at the github repository.

This marked my first time developing a website entirely from scratch, without the use of plugins or web-building tools. I hand-coded the site using only plain HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript, then slapped it up on Github Pages as a static website.

All that stuff I’d been accumulating from my past projects, from Semplice, from Webflow, from Javascriptinfo and more, it all clicked into place. This experience was like connecting the dots and seeing my knowledge come to life. Plus, it wasn’t just about making sense of what I already knew – I got to build more on top of it during the process. Amazing!

  • Bảo Anh as UI/UX designer and web developer
  • Big thanks to Stack Overflow for all the solutions to my problems

item.title: The navigation bar that is in the middle of nowhere
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: The concept of the “navigation bar in the middle of nowhere” had been on my checklist for a while. It could be seen as an additional meaning layer on top of the navigation bar surrounding the four sides on my previous ‘Personal website 2022’. Initially, the website’s objective is to archive all of my video […]
item.content:encoded:
• Visit the vanghoa.github.io/vlog-template/ to see the website.
  • Take a look at the github repository.

The concept of the “navigation bar in the middle of nowhere” had been on my checklist for a while. It could be seen as an additional meaning layer on top of the navigation bar surrounding the four sides on my previous ‘Personal website 2022’.

Initially, the website’s objective is to archive all of my video footages and images during my internship at Practice Theory. The idea was to use the site as a presentation platform for my vlogs, where I would screen record and narrate them using my voice. It was a convenient way to showcase my experiences and work on a weekly basis.

  • Bảo Anh as web developer
  • The website was done as part of an assignment at LASALLE College of the Arts
  • Some materials of the site are from studio Practice Theory

item.title: Open Systems website
item.dc:creator: baoanhbui
item.description: Visit https://opensystems.sg/ to see website. My role involves continuing development from the previous developer (Syahrul), including integrating DatoCMS. This allows SAM staff to structure pages, and folders, and manage content independently without needing a developer. I also had to figure out the CI/CD pipeline to trigger build from DatoCMS to the website hosted on Microsoft […]
item.content:encoded:
Visit https://opensystems.sg/ to see website.

My role involves continuing development from the previous developer (Syahrul), including integrating DatoCMS. This allows SAM staff to structure pages, and folders, and manage content independently without needing a developer. I also had to figure out the CI/CD pipeline to trigger build from DatoCMS to the website hosted on Microsoft Azure Static Web App

The DatoCMS integration involved designing the CMS schema, types, fields, and pages on DatoCMS platform, and mapping the data structure to the actual website on the backend side. I chose static generation for optimal site performance, as the site functions more like a blog without real-time data transfer. Hence, the data will be fetched at the start of each build into individual .JSON files, and then passed into the build. The tech stack primarily includes Node.js, Next.js, and GraphQL.

I wrote a script in Node.js to handle the data fetching, manipulate the data (like slugify), and write them into multiple .JSON files. Why don’t I use Next.js? Because the previous developer used page router for Next.js and I didn’t really know if my app router knowledge could be applied to this. That’s why I wrote the script independently to the Next.js structure.

The CI/CD pipeline is customized for staging and production site, with caching for dependencies package to save time on the build time, and handling of concurrent builds. For the trigger request, I used webhook to link the CMS to the hosted server via github actions.

Besides backend, I also had to restructure and refactor the front-end so that the data can be populated properly with correct types. Since the previous front-end developer didn’t optimize the code in a way that data can be spread out, it was quite a tiring time for me to do this process.

  • Currency Design for creative direction and graphic design
  • Syahrul Anuar (SERIAL CO_) as front-end developer
  • Bao Anh as back-end developer and front-end maintainer
  • Ernest Wu (SERIAL CO_) as project manager
  • This work is done for Singapore Art Museum
